con solo primitivo e ripetitivo occhio-mano-muscolo
routine (Burling, 1950; Leavitt & Whisler, 1958).
Successivamente, i ricercatori operativi e la direzione
gli scienziati sono diventati i nostri cattivi. Anche loro hanno cercato
per programmare esseri umani precedentemente non programmabili
lavoro, sostituendo ancora una volta il giudizio umano con
regole operative. Ma quella volta erano equipaggiati
con artiglieria più pesante. Avevano potenti strumenti quantitativi
e i primi computer.
Nessuno di questi gruppi, tuttavia, è al vertice della classifica odierna.

trans:
The main enemies were industrial engineers and
organizational statutes (Brown, 1947). They were
the job specification leaders. They talked about
"simplification of work" and similar things, and described step-by-step
efficient work routines that have reduced
the worker’s autonomy and replaced human opinions (Lehrer,
1957). Then, we humanizers
considered such groups as "psycho-surgeons", evil decorators
of the brain of manual workers, leaving them
with only primitive and repetitive eye-hand-muscle
routine (Burling, 1950; Leavitt & Whisler, 1958).
Subsequently, the operational researchers and the management
of the scientists have become our villains. They have also tried
to program previously unprogrammable human
work,  once again replacing human opinions with
operating rules. But they were equipped
with heavier artillery. They had powerful quantitative tools
and the first computers.
